channel.title: Ryan's Blog on
channel.description: Recent content in Ryan's Blog on

item.title: Can Copilot pass a coding interview?
item.description: Github Copilot is a natural language model built on OpenAI Codex that suggests code snippets based on existing comments and code. With Copilot, programmers write descriptive comments and function names and Copilot writes the rest. This is hilariously similar to the usual coding interview, which consists of a prompt and a template for a human to fill in with code. What if we replaced the human interviewee with Copilot? Would it generate good enough code to get a job?

item.title: How does React v18's concurrency improve performance?
item.description: The React team has implemented concurrency on a single threaded V8 execution context. How does increased concurrency help when you only have one thread? Let’s take a look at how Operating Systems developers were able to increase the performance of their hardware through the CPU scheduler. First, if you haven’t read the React team’s writeup on their concurrency feature, or their more recent React v18 updates you should. They explain how they implemented it and how to use it.
